description: From French désastreux, from Middle French desastre (“disaster”) (modern désastre), from Italian disastro, itself from dis- (“away, without”) (from Latin) + astro (“star, planet”) (from astrum (“star, celestial body”), from Ancient Greek ᾰ̓́στρον (ástron)). By surface analysis, disaster +‎ -ous.

adjectives.description: disastrous (comparative more disastrous, superlative most disastrous)

entries.meaning: Of the nature of a disaster; calamitous.
